00058 #define PERM_PATHNAME "/etc/lustre/perm.conf"
00059 
00060 /*
00061  * permission file format is like this:
00062  * {nid} {uid} {perms}
00063  *
00064  * '*' nid means any nid
00065  * '*' uid means any uid
00066  * the valid values for perms are:
00067  * setuid/setgid/setgrp/rmtacl           -- enable corresponding perm
00068  * nosetuid/nosetgid/nosetgrp/normtacl   -- disable corresponding perm
00069  * they can be listed together, separated by ',',
00070  * when perm and noperm are in the same line (item), noperm is preferential,
00071  * when they are in different lines (items), the latter is preferential,
00072  * '*' nid is as default perm, and is not preferential.
00073  */
00074 
00075 static char *progname;
00076 
00077 static void usage(void)
00078 {
00079         fprintf(stderr,
00080                 "\nusage: %s {mdtname} {uid}\n"
00081                 "Normally invoked as an upcall from Lustre, set via:\n"
00082                 "lctl set_param mdt.${mdtname}.identity_upcall={path to upcall}\n",
00083                 progname);
00084 }
00085 
00086 static int compare_u32(const void *v1, const void *v2)
00087 {
00088         return (*(__u32 *)v1 - *(__u32 *)v2);
00089 }
00090 
00091 static void errlog(const char *fmt, ...)
00092 {
00093         va_list args;
00094 
00095         openlog(progname, LOG_PERROR | LOG_PID, LOG_AUTHPRIV);
00096 
00097         va_start(args, fmt);
00098         vsyslog(LOG_NOTICE, fmt, args);
00099         va_end(args);
00100 
00101         closelog();
00102 }
00103 
00104 int get_groups_local(struct identity_downcall_data *data,
00105                      unsigned int maxgroups)
00106 {
00107         gid_t *groups, *groups_tmp = NULL;
00108         unsigned int ngroups = 0;
00109         int ngroups_tmp;
00110         struct passwd *pw;
00111         char *pw_name;
00112         int namelen;
00113         int i;
00114 
00115         pw = getpwuid(data->idd_uid);
00116         if (!pw) {
00117                 errlog("no such user %u\n", data->idd_uid);
00118                 data->idd_err = errno ? errno : EIDRM;
00119                 return -1;
00120         }
00121 
00122         data->idd_gid = pw->pw_gid;
00123         namelen = sysconf(_SC_LOGIN_NAME_MAX);
00124         if (namelen < _POSIX_LOGIN_NAME_MAX)
00125                 namelen = _POSIX_LOGIN_NAME_MAX;
00126 
00127         pw_name = malloc(namelen);
00128         if (!pw_name) {
00129                 errlog("malloc error\n");
00130                 data->idd_err = errno;
00131                 return -1;
00132         }
00133 
00134         strlcpy(pw_name, pw->pw_name, namelen);
00135         groups = data->idd_groups;
00136 
00137         /* Allocate array of size maxgroups instead of handling two
00138          * consecutive and potentially racy getgrouplist() calls. */
00139         groups_tmp = malloc(maxgroups * sizeof(gid_t));
00140         if (groups_tmp == NULL) {
00141                 free(pw_name);
00142                 data->idd_err = errno ? errno : ENOMEM;
00143                 errlog("malloc error=%u\n",data->idd_err);
00144                 return -1;
00145         }
00146 
00147         ngroups_tmp = maxgroups;
00148         if (getgrouplist(pw->pw_name, pw->pw_gid, groups_tmp, &ngroups_tmp) <
00149             0) {
00150                 free(pw_name);
00151                 free(groups_tmp);
00152                 data->idd_err = errno ? errno : EIDRM;
00153                 errlog("getgrouplist() error for uid %u: error=%u\n",
00154                         data->idd_uid, data->idd_err);
00155                 return -1;
00156         }
00157 
00158         /* Do not place user's group ID in to the resulting groups list */
00159         for (i = 0; i < ngroups_tmp; i++)
00160                 if (pw->pw_gid != groups_tmp[i])
00161                         groups[ngroups++] = groups_tmp[i];
00162 
00163         if (ngroups > 0)
00164                 qsort(groups, ngroups, sizeof(*groups), compare_u32);
00165         data->idd_ngroups = ngroups;
00166 
00167         free(pw_name);
00168         free(groups_tmp);
00169         return 0;
00170 }
00171 
00172 static inline int comment_line(char *line)
00173 {
00174         char *p = line;
00175 
00176         while (*p && (*p == ' ' || *p == '\t')) p++;
00177 
00178         if (!*p || *p == '\n' || *p == '#')
00179                 return 1;
00180         return 0;
00181 }
00182 
00183 static inline int match_uid(uid_t uid, const char *str)
00184 {
00185         char *end;
00186         uid_t uid2;
00187 
00188         if(!strcmp(str, "*"))
00189                 return -1;
00190 
00191         uid2 = strtoul(str, &end, 0);
00192         if (*end)
00193                 return 0;
00194         return (uid == uid2);
00195 }
00196 
00197 typedef struct {
00198         char   *name;
00199         __u32   bit;
00200 } perm_type_t;
00201 
00202 static perm_type_t perm_types[] = {
00203         { "setuid", CFS_SETUID_PERM },
00204         { "setgid", CFS_SETGID_PERM },
00205         { "setgrp", CFS_SETGRP_PERM },
00206         { "rmtacl", CFS_RMTACL_PERM },
00207         { "rmtown", CFS_RMTOWN_PERM },
00208         { 0 }
00209 };
00210 
00211 static perm_type_t noperm_types[] = {
00212         { "nosetuid", CFS_SETUID_PERM },
00213         { "nosetgid", CFS_SETGID_PERM },
00214         { "nosetgrp", CFS_SETGRP_PERM },
00215         { "normtacl", CFS_RMTACL_PERM },
00216         { "normtown", CFS_RMTOWN_PERM },
00217         { 0 }
00218 };
00219 
00220 int parse_perm(__u32 *perm, __u32 *noperm, char *str)
00221 {
00222         char *start, *end;
00223         char name[64];
00224         perm_type_t *pt;
00225 
00226         *perm = 0;
00227         *noperm = 0;
00228         start = str;
00229         while (1) {
00230                 size_t len;
00231                 memset(name, 0, sizeof(name));
00232                 end = strchr(start, ',');
00233                 if (end == NULL)
00234                         end = str + strlen(str);
00235                 if (start >= end)
00236                         break;
00237                 len = end - start;
00238                 if (len >= sizeof(name))
00239                         return -E2BIG;
00240                 strncpy(name, start, len);
00241                 name[len] = '\0';
00242                 for (pt = perm_types; pt->name; pt++) {
00243                         if (!strcasecmp(name, pt->name)) {
00244                                 *perm |= pt->bit;
00245                                 break;
00246                         }
00247                 }
00248 
00249                 if (!pt->name) {
00250                         for (pt = noperm_types; pt->name; pt++) {
00251                                 if (!strcasecmp(name, pt->name)) {
00252                                         *noperm |= pt->bit;
00253                                         break;
00254                                 }
00255                         }
00256 
00257                         if (!pt->name) {
00258                                 printf("unkown type: %s\n", name);
00259                                 return -1;
00260                         }
00261                 }
00262 
00263                 start = end + 1;
00264         }
00265         return 0;
00266 }
00267 
00268 static int
00269 parse_perm_line(struct identity_downcall_data *data, char *line, size_t size)
00270 {
00271         char uid_str[size];
00272         char nid_str[size];
00273         char perm_str[size];
00274         lnet_nid_t nid;
00275         __u32 perm, noperm;
00276         int rc, i;
00277 
00278         if (data->idd_nperms >= N_PERMS_MAX) {
00279                 errlog("permission count %d > max %d\n",
00280                         data->idd_nperms, N_PERMS_MAX);
00281                 return -1;
00282         }
00283 
00284         rc = sscanf(line, "%s %s %s", nid_str, uid_str, perm_str);
00285         if (rc != 3) {
00286                 errlog("can't parse line %s\n", line);
00287                 return -1;
00288         }
00289 
00290         if (!match_uid(data->idd_uid, uid_str))
00291                 return 0;
00292 
00293         if (!strcmp(nid_str, "*")) {
00294                 nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00295         } else {
00296                 nid = libcfs_str2nid(nid_str);
00297                 if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00298                         errlog("can't parse nid %s\n", nid_str);
00299                         return -1;
00300                 }
00301         }
00302 
00303         if (parse_perm(&perm, &noperm, perm_str)) {
00304                 errlog("invalid perm %s\n", perm_str);
00305                 return -1;
00306         }
00307 
00308         /* merge the perms with the same nid.
00309          *
00310          * If there is LNET_NID_ANY in data->idd_perms[i].pdd_nid,
00311          * it must be data->idd_perms[0].pdd_nid, and act as default perm.
00312          */
00313         if (nid != LNET_NID_ANY) {
00314                 int found = 0;
00315 
00316                 /* search for the same nid */
00317                 for (i = data->idd_nperms - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00318                         if (data->idd_perms[i].pdd_nid == nid) {
00319                                 data->idd_perms[i].pdd_perm =
00320                                         (data->idd_perms[i].pdd_perm | perm) &
00321                                         ~noperm;
00322                                 found = 1;
00323                                 break;
00324                         }
00325                 }
00326 
00327                 /* NOT found, add to tail */
00328                 if (!found) {
00329                         data->idd_perms[data->idd_nperms].pdd_nid = nid;
00330                         data->idd_perms[data->idd_nperms].pdd_perm =
00331                                 perm & ~noperm;
00332                         data->idd_nperms++;
00333                 }
00334         } else {
00335                 if (data->idd_nperms > 0) {
00336                         /* the first one isn't LNET_NID_ANY, need exchange */
00337                         if (data->idd_perms[0].pdd_nid != LNET_NID_ANY) {
00338                                 data->idd_perms[data->idd_nperms].pdd_nid =
00339                                         data->idd_perms[0].pdd_nid;
00340                                 data->idd_perms[data->idd_nperms].pdd_perm =
00341                                         data->idd_perms[0].pdd_perm;
00342                                 data->idd_perms[0].pdd_nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00343                                 data->idd_perms[0].pdd_perm = perm & ~noperm;
00344                                 data->idd_nperms++;
00345                         } else {
00346                                 /* only fix LNET_NID_ANY item */
00347                                 data->idd_perms[0].pdd_perm =
00348                                         (data->idd_perms[0].pdd_perm | perm) &
00349                                         ~noperm;
00350                         }
00351                 } else {
00352                         /* it is the first one, only add to head */
00353                         data->idd_perms[0].pdd_nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00354                         data->idd_perms[0].pdd_perm = perm & ~noperm;
00355                         data->idd_nperms = 1;
00356                 }
00357         }
00358 
00359         return 0;
00360 }
00361 
00362 int get_perms(struct identity_downcall_data *data)
00363 {
00364         FILE *fp;
00365         char line[PATH_MAX];
00366 
00367         fp = fopen(PERM_PATHNAME, "r");
00368         if (fp == NULL) {
00369                 if (errno == ENOENT) {
00370                         return 0;
00371                 } else {
00372                         errlog("open %s failed: %s\n",
00373                                PERM_PATHNAME, strerror(errno));
00374                         data->idd_err = errno;
00375                         return -1;
00376                 }
00377         }
00378 
00379         while (fgets(line, sizeof(line), fp)) {
00380                 if (comment_line(line))
00381                         continue;
00382 
00383                 if (parse_perm_line(data, line, sizeof(line))) {
00384                         errlog("parse line %s failed!\n", line);
00385                         data->idd_err = EINVAL;
00386                         fclose(fp);
00387                         return -1;
00388                 }
00389         }
00390 
00391         fclose(fp);
00392         return 0;
00393 }
00394 
00395 static void show_result(struct identity_downcall_data *data)
00396 {
00397         int i;
00398 
00399         if (data->idd_err) {
00400                 errlog("failed to get identity for uid %d: %s\n",
00401                        data->idd_uid, strerror(data->idd_err));
00402                 return;
00403         }
00404 
00405         printf("uid=%d gid=%d", data->idd_uid, data->idd_gid);
00406         for (i = 0; i < data->idd_ngroups; i++)
00407                 printf(",%u", data->idd_groups[i]);
00408         printf("\n");
00409         printf("permissions:\n"
00410                "  nid\t\t\tperm\n");
00411         for (i = 0; i < data->idd_nperms; i++) {
00412                 struct perm_downcall_data *pdd;
00413 
00414                 pdd = &data->idd_perms[i];
00415 
00416                 printf("  %#jx\t0x%x\n", (uintmax_t)pdd->pdd_nid,
00417                        pdd->pdd_perm);
00418         }
00419         printf("\n");
00420 }
00421 
00422 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00423 {
00424         char *end;
00425         struct identity_downcall_data *data = NULL;
00426         glob_t path;
00427         unsigned long uid;
00428         int fd, rc = -EINVAL, size, maxgroups;
00429 
00430         progname = basename(argv[0]);
00431         if (argc != 3) {
00432                 usage();
00433                 goto out;
00434         }
00435 
00436         uid = strtoul(argv[2], &end, 0);
00437         if (*end) {
00438                 errlog("%s: invalid uid '%s'\n", progname, argv[2]);
00439                 goto out;
00440         }
00441 
00442         maxgroups = sysconf(_SC_NGROUPS_MAX);
00443         if (maxgroups > NGROUPS_MAX)
00444                 maxgroups = NGROUPS_MAX;
00445         if (maxgroups == -1) {
00446                 rc = -EINVAL;
00447                 goto out;
00448         }
00449 
00450         size = offsetof(struct identity_downcall_data, idd_groups[maxgroups]);
00451         data = malloc(size);
00452         if (!data) {
00453                 errlog("malloc identity downcall data(%d) failed!\n", size);
00454                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00455                 goto out;
00456         }
00457 
00458         memset(data, 0, size);
00459         data->idd_magic = IDENTITY_DOWNCALL_MAGIC;
00460         data->idd_uid = uid;
00461         /* get groups for uid */
00462         rc = get_groups_local(data, maxgroups);
00463         if (rc)
00464                 goto downcall;
00465 
00466         size = offsetof(struct identity_downcall_data,
00467                         idd_groups[data->idd_ngroups]);
00468         /* read permission database */
00469         rc = get_perms(data);
00470 
00471 downcall:
00472         if (getenv("L_GETIDENTITY_TEST")) {
00473                 show_result(data);
00474                 rc = 0;
00475                 goto out;
00476         }
00477 
00478         rc = cfs_get_param_paths(&path, "mdt/%s/identity_info", argv[1]);
00479         if (rc != 0) {
00480                 rc = -errno;
00481                 goto out;
00482         }
00483 
00484         fd = open(path.gl_pathv[0], O_WRONLY);
00485         if (fd < 0) {
00486                 errlog("can't open file '%s':%s\n", path.gl_pathv[0],
00487                        strerror(errno));
00488                 rc = -errno;
00489                 goto out_params;
00490         }
00491 
00492         rc = write(fd, data, size);
00493         close(fd);
00494         if (rc != size) {
00495                 errlog("partial write ret %d: %s\n", rc, strerror(errno));
00496                 rc = -1;
00497         } else {
00498                 rc = 0;
00499         }
00500 
00501 out_params:
00502         cfs_free_param_data(&path);
00503 out:
00504         if (data != NULL)
00505                 free(data);
00506         return rc;
00507 }
